name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Berlin

reviews.text: Radisson Blu is very well located, by the Spree and at the heart of the museums area. Rooms are good, as is the service, with the Heat Restaurant providing a relaxing atmosphere. And the aquarium is a lot of fun.
reviews.title: A great hotel in Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was ideally situated in central Berlin, close to Museum Island, Berliner Dom, Hackescher Markt and Unter Den Linden which has a Opernpalais cafe serving a large cake buffet. We walked from the hotel to other attractions like Reichstag, Brandenburg gate, Potsdamer Platz and Friedrichstrasse.
reviews.title: 40th birthday trip
good hotel, very poor fitness centre
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel we were given a choice of a room with windows facing the large aquarium or one where windows face outwards. After a day exploring Berlin it was great to relax and enjoy the aquarium view from the room, before leaving for the evening entertainment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly, and when I ordered room service one night the prices were comparable with restaurants / bars in the area. I would highly recommend this hotel and Berlin for a city break. We really enjoyed Berlin and I'm looking to plan my return trip to explore areas that we didn't get round to the first time. Germany has spent a lot of time, effort and money on their capital and it shows.
reviews.title: Average 4* city hotel, clean and nice but lacks a little charm

reviews.text: As a price guide - In Central Berlin we paid approximately 15 Euros per head in restaurants, and 4 Euros for half litre of local beer (Berliner Pilsner, Erdinger). My wife really enjoyed Schofferhofer in a variety of flavours (Grapefruit, Pear&Ginger, Ice, Cactus). The hotel room service prices were similar, but we didn't eat in the hotel restaurant 'Heat', which did have good reviews in Berlin guides.
reviews.title: Would recommend this hotel to anyone who visit Berlin

reviews.text: My stay was 3 days, 2 nights on buiness a few weeks before Christmas. The location was selected by our team because of cost, but we agreed it was good value for money. Not to mention the spectacle of the indoor aquarium! Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great location, service and facilities!

reviews.text: Very friendly and professional welcome- in fact this was displayed throughout. The staff were really pleasant and all our queries were answered promptly and dealt with efficiently. Nice room overlooking the aquarium but it did get a bit stuffy and we never did get to grips with the air-con.. .. comfortable beds, decent toiletries (it's a girly thing) and loved the shower.

reviews.text: As soon as we entered the hotel our luggage was taken from us and we were directed to check in. The check was quick,efficient and polite. The room was a good top chain hotel room. Very good housekeeping service every day. I needed an extra pillow and it was brought to the room in two or three minutes. Breakfast was always busy but we never waited more than a couple of minutes for a table. The choice and quality was excellent.

This is a really nice hotel, with excellent decor all round – very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Radisson Blu in Berlin is the perfect place to stay for a city break. It is located very close to Alexnderplatz with transport links to the rest of the city. The hotel is amazing with large luxurious rooms and views of the river and the Aquadom. The staff were very friendly and there was an excellent choice of food for breakfast. We visited Berlin to experience the Christmas markets which we would definitely recommend!
reviews.title: The perfect hotel for a city break!

reviews.text: I certainly think this is one of the better hotels in Berlin!! Unfortunately there is no airport shuttle to the hotel but the regulares city buses from the airport are easy. The building is impressive in a neighbourhoud with lot of shops, very close to Sealife Center and eateries, in fact a very good vietnamese/thai restaurant around the corner, Shytake, where we ate all 3 nights. Upon arrival the lobby is so impressive with the massive fish tank!! We got a room with view facing the lobby (I got to choose), they unfortunately only had the first floor available but I got to see a little bit of the fish tank from the room, so I was happy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay at this hotel for a long weekend in may. On entering the hotel i was impressed by the fish tank, nothing else about this hotel is impressive. The location is good for sightseeing, the rooms are clean and the bed is very comfy,breakfast is also nice but 5 star no. I have stayed in better 3 star. No tea or coffee making facilitise in your room which is something i realy missed. One night when i came back from being out i phoned down to try and get a coffee i was told it would take about 1 hour as all the coffee machines were off. this is not 5 star 24 hour room service to me. To sum it up i would say this is a very over priced 3 star hotel. Oh sorry forgot to say they do have a very nice leisure pool and sauna, steam room out of order.
reviews.title: Great hotel, nice location

aka: Radisson Blu Hotel, Berlin Hotel Berlin
description: The Radisson Blu Hotel features the worldwide largest cylindrical aquarium and has an excellent location in Berlin-Mitte. Just a strolls away are restaurants, bars, boutiques, galleries and famous sights. The hotel is located directly on the bank of the river Spree, opposite to the Berlin Cathedral and Museum Island. Public transport and the Berlin airport are within easy reach. All 427 non-smoking rooms and suites offer fantastic views of Berlin or the tropical underwater world of the AquaDom. The fully equipped and contemporary designed rooms reflecting urban trends and guarantee a pleasant stay. Wireless LAN and high-speed Internet access is included in the room rate. The restaurant, bar as well as the well-being area with pool, saunas and 24-hours fitness room are inviting to indulgence and relaxation.
